briefdescription.para: Macro for creating an RTC driver instance.
RTC driver default configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
This configuration sets up RTC with the following options:
frequency 32.768 kHz
maximum latency 2000 us
reliability checks disabled

Event handler provided by the user. Must not be NULL.
Successfully initialized.

briefdescription.para: Function for uninitializing the RTC driver instance.

detaileddescription.para: After uninitialization, the instance is in idle state. The hardware should return to the state before initialization.

memberdef.name: nrfx_rtc_cc_set

briefdescription.para: Function for setting a compare channel.

detaileddescription.para: The function powers on the instance if the instance was in power off state.

The driver is not entering a critical section when configuring RTC, which means that it can be preempted for a certain amount of time. When the driver was preempted and the value to be set is short in time, there is a risk that the driver sets a compare value that is behind. In this case, if the reliable mode is enabled for the specified instance, the risk is handled. However, to detect if the requested value is behind, this mode makes the following assumptions:
The maximum preemption time in ticks (8-bit value) is known and is less than 7.7 ms (for prescaler = 0, RTC frequency 32 kHz).
The requested absolute compare value is not bigger than (0x00FFFFFF)-tick_latency. It is the user's responsibility to ensure this.

simplesect.para: Once the compare event is received, corresponding compare channel will be disabled before executing event handler provided by the user.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
One of the channels of the instance.
Absolute value to be set in the compare register.
True to enable the interrupt. False to disable the interrupt.
The procedure is successful.
The compare is not set because the request value is behind the current counter value. This error can only be reported if the reliable mode is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling a channel.

detaileddescription.para: This function disables channel events and channel interrupts.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
One of the channels of the instance.
The procedure is successful.
Interrupt is pending on the requested channel.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling the TICK event.

detaileddescription.para: This function enables the tick event and optionally the interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
True to enable the interrupt. False to disable the interrupt.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling the TICK event.

detaileddescription.para: This function disables the TICK event and interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling overflow.

detaileddescription.para: This function enables the overflow event and optionally the interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
True to enable the interrupt. False to disable the interrupt.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling overflow.

detaileddescription.para: This function disables the overflow event and interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the maximum relative tick value that can be set in the compare channel.

detaileddescription.para: When a stack (for example SoftDevice) is used and it occupies high priority interrupts, the application code can be interrupted at any moment for a certain period of time. If the reliable mode is enabled, the provided maximum latency is taken into account and the return value is smaller than the RTC counter resolution. If the reliable mode is disabled, the return value equals the counter resolution.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling all instance interrupts.
